17-809   Parking and loading regulations
§ 17-801 INTENT AND PURPOSE OF DISTRICT.
   The "R-M" Residential Medium Density District is established to provide for
single-family rural residential development at a higher density than is
allowable in either the “A-L” or “R-L” zones. This zone is intended for
application in developing areas adjacent to the city, and is intended to
minimize conflicts of incompatible uses of land; to protect the public health
and welfare until the area is annexed; and to provide for compatible private
and public facilities with appropriate open spaces.
§ 17-802 DISTRICT REGULATIONS.
   In the "R-M" District, no building or land shall be used and no building or
structure shall be erected, altered or enlarged which is arranged, intended, or
designed for other than one of the uses listed in §
17-803 below.
§ 17-803 USE REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Single-family dwellings.
   (b)   Residential design manufactured homes.
   (c)   Foster homes.
   (d)   Group homes.
   (e)   Churches and similar places of worship and parish houses.
   (f)   Golf courses, except miniature golf courses and driving tees operated
for commercial purposes.
   (g)   Hospitals for people only on a lot, plot, or tract of land five acres
or larger.
   (h)   Nursing homes and assisted living facilities on a lot, plot, or tract
of land five acres or larger.
   (i)   Public parks, playgrounds, recreational areas.
   (j)   Raising of crops, trees, shrubs, and grasses not sold on the premises.
   (k)   Registered family day care.
   (l)   Customary accessory uses and structures located on the same lot with
the principal use including tennis courts, swimming pools, private garages,
garden houses, barbecue ovens, and fireplaces.
   (m)   Temporary structures incidental to construction work, but only for the
period of work. Basements and cellars may not be occupied for residential
purposes until the building is completed.
   (n)   General farm operations excluding activities which are noxious or
offensive by reasons of dust, odor, or noise.
   (o)   Cemeteries.
   (p)   Any public building erected or land used by any department of the
city, county, state, or federal government.
   (q)   The following uses may be allowed by special use permit when
submitted, reviewed, and approved by the Board of Zoning Appeals, and under
such conditions as the Board may impose:
      (1)   Adult day care.
      (2)   Home occupations.
      (3)   Licensed day care homes.
      (4)   Preschools.
      (5)   Child care centers.
      (6)   Bed and breakfast.
      (7)   Catering business.
§ 17-804 INTENSITY OF USE REGULATIONS.
   Lots in this district shall be subject to the following minimum size
requirements:
   (a)   Buildings served by private water wells and septic systems - five
acres.
   (b)   Buildings served by a public water system and a private septic system
- three acres.
   (c)   Buildings served by a public water system and a public sewer system -
8,400 square feet.
   (d)   Lots shall have an average tract or lot width of not less than 70
feet, or as required by the Pottawatomie County Sanitarian.
   (e)   Installation of lagoon systems shall only be permitted upon review and
recommendation of the Wamego Planning Commission. Said review shall consider
the recommendation of the Pottawatomie County Sanitarian.
§ 17-805 LOT COVERAGE.
   The principal building and accessory buildings shall not cover more than 30%
of the lot area.
§ 17-806 HEIGHT REGULATIONS.
   No building shall exceed 35 feet in height.
§ 17-807 YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Front yard.
      (1)   There shall be a front yard having a depth of not less than 25
feet, except as required for arterial and collector streets in
Article 29 of this Title.
      (2)   Where a lot or group of lots have a double frontage, the required
front yard shall be provided on both streets.
      (3)   Where a lot is located at the intersection of two or more streets,
there shall be a front yard on each street side of a corner lot; provided,
however, that the buildable width of a single lot of record as of the effective
date of this Title shall not be reduced to less than 35 feet.
   (b)   Side yard. Except as hereinafter required in the additional height,
area and use regulations, there shall be a side yard setback of not less than
10% of the width of the lot with a minimum of five feet and a maximum required
setback of 15 feet. A roof overhang of one foot into the required side yard
setback area is permitted.
   (c)   Rear yard. There shall be a rear yard having a depth of not less than
25 feet.
§ 17-808 SIGN REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 24 of this Title.
§ 17-809 PARKING AND LOADING REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 25 of this Title.
ARTICLE 9: “R-H” HISTORIC TOWNSITE RESIDENTIAL DISTRICT
Section
   
17-901   Intent and purpose of district
   
17-902   District regulations
   
17-903   Use regulations
   
17-904   Intensity of use regulations
   
17-905   Lot coverage
   
17-906   Height regulations
   
17-907   Yard regulations
   
17-908   Sign regulations
   
17-909   Parking and loading regulations
   
17-910   Landscaping and stormwater management requirements
§ 17-901 INTENT AND PURPOSE OF DISTRICT.
   The "R-H" Historic Townsite Residential District is established for the
purpose of recognizing the unique platting and development characteristics
common to the older residential neighborhoods in Wamego, and to help preserve
the quality of the living environment in such areas. The regulations are
intended to provide continuation of established residential development
densities together with preservation of the physical environment and aesthetic
qualities which have been traditional in the original neighborhoods of the
community.
§ 17-902 DISTRICT REGULATIONS.
   In the "R-H" District, no building or structure shall be used and no
building or structure shall be erected, altered or enlarged which is arranged,
intended, or designed for other than one of the uses listed in §
17-903 below.
§ 17-903 USE REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Single-family dwellings.
   (b)   Two-family (duplex) and not more than two single-family attached
dwellings subject to approval by the Planning Commission and to the following:
      (1)   Minimum lot size shall be 8,400 square feet with a minimum lot
width of 60 feet.
      (2)   The structure shall be architecturally compatible with other
residential structures in the surrounding neighborhood.
      (3)   There shall be provision for off-street parking for at least four
vehicles.
      (4)   The lot shall be appropriately landscaped to enhance the visual
quality of the block. This shall include screening and/or buffering of adjacent
residences where deemed necessary by the Board.
      (5)   The applicant shall submit with his application for a duplex a site
plan concept design sketch showing details of lot improvement.
      (6)   When reviewed and approved by the Planning Commission, the site
plan design sketch shall constitute a condition of authority for development.
      (7)   Existing duplex structures as of the date of this Title are exempt
from these requirements.
   (c)   Residential design manufactured housing.
   (d)   Foster homes.
   (e)   Group homes.
   (f)   Churches and similar places of worship and parish houses.
   (g)   Hospitals for people only on a lot, plot, or tract of land five acres
or larger.
   (h)   Nursing homes and assisted living facilities on a lot, plot, or tract
of land five acres or larger.
   (i)   Public parks, playgrounds, recreational areas.
   (j)   Registered family day care.
   (k)   Schools - public or parochial, elementary, junior high and high
schools, and private schools with equivalent curriculum.
   (l)   Customary accessory uses and structures located on the same lot with
the principal use including tennis courts, swimming pools, private garages,
garden houses, barbecue ovens, and fireplaces, but which do not include uses
unrelated to the principal use or any activity commonly conducted for gain.
   (m)   Temporary structures incidental to construction work, but only for the
period of such work. Basements and cellars may not be occupied for residential
purposes until the building is completed.
   (n)   The following uses may be allowed by special use permit when
submitted, reviewed, and approved by the Board of Zoning Appeals, and under
such conditions as the Board may impose:
      (1)   Adult day care.
      (2)   Home occupations.
      (3)   Licensed day care homes.
      (4)   Preschools.
      (5)   Child care centers.
      (6)   Bed and breakfast establishments.
§ 17-904 INTENSITY OF USE REGULATIONS.
   Every lot shall have an area of not less than 6,000 square feet and an
average width of not less than 50 feet.
§ 17-905 LOT COVERAGE.
   The principal building and accessory buildings shall not cover more than 30%
of the lot area, excepting that, where a single lot of record, as defined in
the definitions section of this Title, as of the effective date of this Title,
has an area of not more than 7,500 square feet, the principal building and
accessory buildings shall not cover more than 35% of the lot area.
§ 17-906 HEIGHT REGULATIONS.
   No building shall exceed 35 feet in height.
§ 17-907 YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Front yard.
      (1)   There shall be a front yard having a depth of not less than 25
feet, except as required for arterial and collector streets in
Article 29 of this Title.
      (2)   Where a lot or group of lots have a double frontage, the required
front yard shall be provided on both streets.
      (3)   Where a lot is located at the intersection of two or more streets,
there shall be a front yard on each street side of a corner lot; provided,
however, that the buildable width of a single lot of record, as of the
effective date of this Title, shall not be reduced to less than 35 feet.
      (4)   Where a principal or accessory building existing as of the
effective date of this Title, encroaches upon the required foot front yard, and
where the building is on a single lot of record, as defined in the definitions
section of this Title, established prior to the effective date of said Title
and having an area of not more than 7,500 square feet, an addition to said
building shall be permitted, provided the addition does not encroach further
into the required front yard than the furthest projection of said building, and
providing that said addition represents not more than 50% of the lot coverage
of the existing building.
   (b)   Side yard.
      (1)   There shall be a side yard building setback which shall be one-
third the height of the principal building or 10% of the width of the lot,
whichever is the greater, with a minimum of five feet, and a maximum required
setback of 15 feet. A roof overhang of one foot into the required side yard
setback area is permitted; unless otherwise prescribed and/or approved by the
Planning Commission.
      (2)   Where more than one principal building is constructed on a tract
for hospital use, nursing home use, church use, school use, and other public
uses, the spacing between principal buildings shall not be less than the
average height of the adjacent buildings.
      (3)   Where a principal or accessory building existing as of the
effective date of this Title, encroaches upon the required side yard, and where
the building is on a single lot of record, as defined in the definitions of
this Title, established prior to the effective date of said Title and having an
area of not more than 7,500 square feet, an addition to said building shall be
permitted, provided the addition does not encroach further into the required
side yard than the furthest projection of said building, and providing that
said addition represents not more than 50% of the lot coverage of the existing
building.
   (c)   Rear yard. There shall be a rear yard having a depth of not less than
25 feet.
§ 17-908 SIGN REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 24 of this Title.
§ 17-909 PARKING AND LOADING REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 25 of this Title.
§ 17-910 LANDSCAPING AND STORMWATER MANAGEMENT REQUIREMENTS.
   In addition to the general requirements of
Article 26 of this Title all new development, or substantial modifications of
existing development, in the "R-H" zone shall hereinafter be subject to the
following additional requirements which are intended to preserve and extend the
visual quality of the neighborhood.
   (a)   Existing street trees three inches or greater in trunk diameter shall
be preserved where practicable.
   (b)   Where preservation is impractical, and existing street trees three
inches or greater in trunk diameter are removed to accommodate new
construction, replacement trees of similar type and future mature size shall be
installed during the next seasonal planting period. Street tree replacements
shall be required on a one for one basis.
ARTICLE 9-A: “RH-O” HISTORIC TOWNSITE RESIDENTIAL OVERLAY DISTRICT
Section
   
17-901-A   Intent and purpose of district
   
17-902-A   District regulations
   
17-903-A   Use regulations
   
17-904-A   Intensity of use regulations
   
17-905-A   Lot coverage
   
17-906-A   Height regulations
   
17-907-A   Yard regulations
   
17-908-A   Sign regulations
   
17-909-A   Parking and loading regulations
   
17-910-A   Landscaping and stormwater requirements
   
17-911-A   Traffic regulations
§ 17-901-A INTENT AND PURPOSE OF DISTRICT.
   The "RH-O" Historic Townsite Residential Overlay District is established for
the purpose of permitting residential uses along with the allowable uses of the
parent district. It is intended that this district be applied in commercial
district fringe locations where older homes exist in close proximity with non-
residential land uses, such as at the edge of the Central Business District.
§ 17-902-A DISTRICT REGULATIONS.
   In the "RH O" District, no building or structure shall be used and no
building or structure shall be erected, altered or enlarged which is arranged,
intended or designed for other than one of the uses listed in §
17-903-A below.
§ 17-903-A USE REGULATIONS.
   (a)   All uses in the "R-H" Historic Townsite Residential District.
   (b)   Uses and structures permitted under the provisions of the regulations
of the parent district, of which this district is made a part.
§ 17-904-A INTENSITY OF USE REGULATIONS.
   Every lot shall have an area of not less than 6,000 square feet and an
average width of not less than 50 feet. A minimum of 1,500 square feet of lot
area shall be required for each apartment built above ground floor.
§ 17-905-A LOT COVERAGE.
   For all uses allowable in the "RH-O" Historic Townsite Residential Overlay
District, the principal building and accessory buildings shall not cover more
than 30% of the lot areas, excepting that, where a single lot of record, as
defined in the definitions section of this Title, as of the effective date of
the Title, has an area of not more than 7,500 square feet, the principal
building and accessory buildings shall not cover more than 35% of the lot area.
For all uses not allowable in the "RH-O" District, the lot coverage provisions
of the parent district, if any, shall apply.
§ 17-906-A HEIGHT REGULATIONS.
   No building allowable in the "RH-O" Historic Townsite Residential Overlay
District shall exceed 35 feet in height. For all uses not allowable in the "RH-
O" District, the height provisions of the parent district shall apply.
§ 17-907-A YARD REGULATIONS.
   The yard requirements of the "RH-O" Historic Townsite Residential Overlay
District shall apply for all uses allowable in the "RH-O" District. For all
uses not allowable in the "RH-O" District the yard requirements of the parent
district shall apply.
§ 17-908-A SIGN REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 24 of this Title.
§ 17-909-A PARKING AND LOADING REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 25 of this Title.
§ 17-910-A LANDSCAPING AND STORMWATER REQUIREMENTS.
   For all uses allowable in the "RH-O" Historic Townsite Residential Overlay
District, the landscaping requirements of the “R-H” District shall apply. For
all uses not allowable in the “R-H” District, the landscaping requirements of
the parent district shall apply.
§ 17-911-A TRAFFIC REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 27 of this Title.
ARTICLE 10: “R-1" SINGLE-FAMILY DWELLING DISTRICT
Section
   
17-1001   Intent and purpose of district
   
17-1002   District regulations
   
17-1003   Use regulations
   
17-1004   Intensity of use regulations
   
17-1005   Lot coverage
   
17-1006   Height regulations
   
17-1007   Yard regulations
   
17-1008   Sign regulations
   
17-1009   Parking and loading regulations
§ 17-1001 INTENT AND PURPOSE OF DISTRICT.
   The "R-1" Single-Family Dwelling District is established for the purpose of
low density, single-family dwelling use and to allow certain public facilities.
It is intended that no uses be permitted in this district that will tend to
devalue property for residential purposes or interfere with the health, safety,
order, or general welfare of persons residing in the district. Regulations are
intended to control density of population and to provide adequate open space
around buildings and structures in the district to accomplish these purposes.
§ 17-1002 DISTRICT REGULATIONS.
   In the "R-1" District, no building or structure shall be used and no
building or structure shall be erected, altered or enlarged which is arranged,
intended, or designed for other than one of the uses listed in §
17-1003 below.
§ 17-1003 USE REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Single-family dwellings.
   (b)   Residential design manufactured housing.
   (c)   Foster homes.
   (d)   Group homes.
   (e)   Churches and similar places of worship and parish houses.
   (f)   Golf courses, except miniature golf courses and driving tees operated
for commercial purposes.
   (g)   Hospitals for people only on a lot, plot, or tract of land five acres
or larger.
   (h)   Nursing homes and assisted living facilities on a lot, plot, or tract
of land five acres or larger.
   (i)   Public parks, playgrounds, recreational areas.
   (j)   Raising of crops, trees, shrubs, and grasses not sold on the premises.
   (k)   Registered family day care.
   (l)   Customary accessory uses and structures located on the same lot with
the principal use including tennis courts, swimming pools, private garages,
garden houses, barbecue ovens, and fireplaces, but which do not include uses
unrelated to the principal use or any activity commonly conducted for gain.
   (m)   Temporary structures incidental to construction work, but only for the
period of such work. Basements and cellars may not be occupied for residential
purposes until the building is completed.
   (n)   The following uses may be allowed by special use permit when
submitted, reviewed, and approved by the Board of Zoning Appeals, and under
such conditions as the Board may impose:
      (1)   Adult day care.
      (2)   Home occupations.
      (3)   Licensed day care homes.
      (4)   Preschools.
      (5)   Child care centers.
      (6)   Bed and breakfast.
      (7)   Catering business.
§ 17-1004 INTENSITY OF USE REGULATIONS.
   Every lot shall have an area of not less than 6,000 square feet and an
average width of not less than 65 feet.
§ 17-1005 LOT COVERAGE.
   The principal building and accessory buildings shall not cover more than 30%
of the lot area, excepting that, where a single lot of record, as defined in
the definitions section of this Title, as of the effective date of this Title,
has an area of not more than 7,500 square feet, the principal building and
accessory buildings shall not cover more than 35% of the lot area.
§ 17-1006 HEIGHT REGULATIONS.
   No building shall exceed 35 feet in height.
§ 17-1007 YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Front yard.
      (1)   There shall be a front yard having a depth of not less than 25
feet, except as required for arterial and collector streets in
Article 29 of this Title.
      (2)   Where a lot or group of lots have a double frontage, the required
front yard shall be provided on both streets.
      (3)   Where a lot is located at the intersection of two or more streets,
there shall be a front yard on each street side of a corner lot; provided,
however, that the buildable width of a single lot of record, as of the
effective date of this Title, shall not be reduced to less than 35 feet.
      (4)   Where a principal or accessory building existing as of the
effective date of this Title, encroaches upon the required 25 foot front yard,
and where the building is on a single lot of record, as defined in the
definitions section of this Title, established prior to the effective date of
said Title and having an area of not more than 7,500 square feet, an addition
to said building shall be permitted, provided the addition does not encroach
further into the required front yard than the furthest projection of said
building, and providing that said addition represents not more than 50% of the
lot coverage of the existing building.
   (b)   Side yard.
      (1)   There shall be a side yard building setback which shall be one-
third the height of the principal building or 10% of the width of the lot,
whichever is the greater, with a minimum of five feet, and a maximum required
setback of 15 feet. A roof overhang of one foot into the required side yard
setback area is permitted; unless otherwise prescribed and/or approved by the
Planning Commission.
      (2)   Where more than one principal building is constructed on a tract
for hospital use, nursing home use, church use, school use, and other public
uses, the spacing between principal buildings shall not be less than the
average height of the adjacent buildings.
      (3)   Where a principal or accessory building existing as of the
effective date of this Title, encroaches upon the required side yard, and where
the building is on a single lot of record, as defined in the definitions
section of this Title, established prior to the effective date of said Title
and having an area of not more than 7,500 square feet, an addition to said
building shall be permitted, provided the addition does not encroach further
into the required side yard than the furthest projection of said building, and
providing that said addition represents not more than 50% of the lot coverage
of the existing building.
   (c)   Rear yard. There shall be a rear yard having a depth of not less than
25 feet.
§ 17-1008 SIGN REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 24 of this Title.
§ 17-1009 PARKING AND LOADING REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 25 of this Title.
ARTICLE 11: “R-2" SINGLE-FAMILY DWELLING DISTRICT
Section
   
17-1101   Intent and purpose of district
   
17-1102   District regulations
   
17-1103   Use regulations
   
17-1104   Intensity of use regulations
   
17-1105   Lot coverage
   
17-1106   Height regulations
   
17-1107   Yard regulations
   
17-1108   Sign regulations
   
17-1109   Parking and loading regulations
§ 17-1101 INTENT AND PURPOSE OF DISTRICT.
   The "R-2" Two-Family Dwelling District is intended for the purpose of
allowing a slightly higher density than in district "R-1", yet retaining the
residential qualities. This district allows duplex uses, single-family attached
dwellings joined to no more than one similar dwelling and single-family homes,
certain community facilities, and certain special uses.
§ 17-1102 DISTRICT REGULATIONS.
   In the "R-2" District, no building or land shall be used and no building or
structure shall be erected, altered or enlarged which is arranged, intended, or
designed for other than one of the uses listed in §
17-1103 below.
§ 17-1103 USE REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Single-family detached dwellings, providing no more than one dwelling
is placed upon the lot or plot as defined by this Title unless the following
conditions are met:
      (1)   The lot has an area of at least 11,250 square feet.
      (2)   One dwelling is placed to the side of the other dwelling, with no
portion of either unit located behind the other.
      (3)   The foundation walls of the dwellings are separated by at least ten
feet.
   (b)   Residential design manufactured homes.
   (c)   Foster homes.
   (d)   Group homes.
   (e)   Single-family attached dwellings joined to no more than one similar
dwelling.
   (f)   Two-family dwellings (duplex).
   (g)   Boarding, rooming, and lodging houses.
   (h)   Community recreation buildings owned and operated by a public agency.
   (i)   Churches and similar places of worship and parish houses.
   (j)   Golf courses, except miniature golf courses and driving tees operated
for commercial purposes.
   (k)   Hospitals on a parcel of land not less than two acres in size (but not
animal hospitals or mental hospitals).
   (l)   Registered family day care.
   (m)   Public buildings.
   (n)   Public parks, playgrounds, and recreation areas.
   (o)   Raising of crops, trees, shrubs, and grasses not sold on the premises.
   (p)   Nonprofit institutions of an educational, philanthropic, or
eleemosynary nature, but not penal institutions.
   (q)   Nursing homes for the aged and assisted living facilities on a tract
of land not less than two acres in size.
   (r)   Customary accessory uses and structures located on the same lot or
group of lots with the principal use including tennis courts, swimming pools,
private garages, garden houses, barbecue ovens, and fireplaces, but does not
include use unrelated to the principal use of any activity commonly conducted
for gain.
   (s)   Temporary structures incidental to construction work, but only for the
period of such work. Basements and cellars may not be occupied for residential
purposes until the building is complete.
   (t)   The following uses may be allowed by special use permit when
submitted, reviewed, and approved by the Board of Zoning appeals and under such
conditions as the Board may impose:
      (1)   Adult day care.
      (2)   Home occupations.
      (3)   Licensed day care homes.
      (4)   Preschools.
      (5)   Child care centers.
      (6)   Bed and breakfast.
      (7)   Catering business.
§ 17-1104 INTENSITY OF USE REGULATIONS.
   Lots in this district shall be subject to the following minimum size
requirements:
   (a)   Single-family buildings.
      (1)   Buildings served by private water wells and septic systems - five
acres.
      (2)   Buildings served by a public water system and a private septic
system - three acres.
      (3)   Buildings served by a public water system and a public sewer system
- 6,000 square feet.
      (4)   Installation of lagoon systems shall only be permitted upon review
and recommendation of the Wamego Planning Commission. Said review shall
consider the recommendation of the Pottawatomie County Sanitarian.
   (b)   Two-family and single-family attached buildings.
      (1)   If each building or dwelling unit is served by private water wells
and septic systems - five acres each building or dwelling unit.
      (2)   If each building or dwelling unit is served by a public water
system and a private septic system - three acres each building.
      (3)   If each building or dwelling unit is served by a public water
system and sewer system - 3,700 square feet per dwelling unit.
      (4)   If each building or dwelling is served by a shared private water or
sewer system, a basic site plan must be submitted prior to the rezoning process
for Wamego City Staff and Planning Commission review, and the area minimums of
divisions (b)(1) and (b)(3) above may be increased by as much as 40% prior to
development. The recommendations of the Pottawatomie County Sanitarian shall be
considered during review.
   (c)   Dormitories, lodging houses, nursing homes, and boarding houses shall,
in addition to meeting the above requirements for single-family buildings,
provide at least 500 square feet of lot area for each occupant.
   (d)   Minimum lot width shall be as required by the Pottawatomie County
Sanitarian if served by a private water and/or sewer system.
   (e)   Installation of lagoon systems shall only be permitted upon review and
recommendation of the Wamego Planning Commission. Said review shall consider
the recommendation of the Pottawatomie County Sanitarian.
§ 17-1105 LOT COVERAGE.
   The principal building and accessory buildings shall not cover more than 40%
of the lot area.
§ 17-1106 HEIGHT REGULATIONS.
   No building shall exceed 45 feet in height.
§ 17-1107 YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Front yard.
      (1)   There shall be a front yard having a depth of not less than 25
feet, except as required for arterial and collector streets in
Article 29 of this Title.
      (2)   Where a lot or group of lots have a double frontage, the required
front yard shall be provided on both streets.
      (3)   Where a lot is located at the intersection of two or more streets,
there shall be a front yard on each street side of a corner lot; provided,
however, that the buildable width of a single lot of record as of the effective
date of this Title shall not be reduced to less than 35 feet.
      (4)   Where a principal or accessory building existing as of the
effective date of this Title, encroaches upon the required 25 foot front yard,
and where the building is on a single lot of record, as defined in the
definitions section of this Title, established prior to the effective date of
said Title and having an area of not more than 7,500 square feet, an addition
to said building shall be permitted, provided the addition does not encroach
further into the required front yard than the furthest projection of said
building, and providing that said addition represents not more than 50% of the
lot coverage of the existing building.
   (b)   Side yard.
      (1)   There shall be a side yard building setback which shall be one-
third the height of the principal building or 10% of the width of the lot,
whichever is the greater, with a minimum of five feet and a maximum required
setback of 15 feet. A roof overhang of one foot into the required side yard
setback area is permitted.
      (2)   Where more than one principal building is constructed on a tract
for hospital use, nursing home use, church use, school use, and other public or
quasi-public uses, the spacing of said buildings shall not be less than the
average height of the adjacent buildings.
      (3)   Where a principal or accessory building existing as of the
effective date of this Title, encroaches upon the required side yard, and where
the building is on a single lot of record, as defined in the definitions
section of this Title, established prior to the effective date of said Title
and having an area of not more than 7,500 feet, an addition to said building
shall be permitted, provided the addition does not encroach further into the
required side yard than the furthest projection of said building, and providing
that said addition represents not more than 50% of the lot coverage of the
existing building.
   (c)   Rear yard. There shall be a rear yard for each principal building in
this district which shall have a depth of not less than 25 feet, except that,
where a single-family attached lot is located at the intersection of two or
more streets, no rear yard shall be required along the common wall.
§ 17-1108 SIGN REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 24 of this Title.

   See

ARTICLE 12: “R-3" MULTIPLE-FAMILY DWELLING DISTRICT
Section

§ 17-1201 INTENT AND PURPOSE OF DISTRICT.
   The "R-3" Multiple-Family Dwelling District is intended for the purpose of
allowing high residential density land use with the co-mingling of compatible
single-family, single-family attached, and two-family dwellings, apartments,
home occupations, certain community facilities, and certain special uses, yet
retaining the basic residential qualities.
§ 17-1202 DISTRICT REGULATIONS.
   In the "R-3" District, no building shall be used and no building or
structure shall be erected, altered or enlarged which is arranged, intended, or
designed for other than one of the uses listed in §
17-1203 below.
§ 17-1203 USE REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Any use permitted in the "R-2" Two-Family Dwelling District.
   (b)   Multiple-family dwellings.
   (c)   Private clubs, fraternities, sororities, and lodges, except those
where the chief activity is a service customarily carried on as a business.
   (d)   Single-family attached dwellings, joined to either one or two similar
dwelling(s).
   (e)   The following uses may be allowed by special use permit when
submitted, reviewed, and approved by the Board of Zoning appeals, and under
such conditions as the Board may impose:
      (1)   Adult day care.
      (2)   Home occupations.
      (3)   Licensed day care homes.
      (4)   Preschools.
      (5)   Child care centers.
      (6)   Bed and breakfast.
      (7)   Catering business.
§ 17-1204 INTENSITY OF USE REGULATIONS.
   Lots in this district shall be subject to the following minimum size
requirements:
   (a)   Single-family buildings, same as "R-2" District requirements (see §
17-1104(a)).
   (b)   Two-family and single-family attached buildings, same as "R-2"
District requirements (see §
17-1104(b)).
   (c)   Dormitories, lodging houses, nursing homes, and boarding houses, same
as "R-2" District requirements (see §
17-1104(c)).
   (d)   Multi-family buildings.
      (1)   If the building or buildings are not to be served by a public water
and/or sewer system, a site plan must be submitted to the Wamego City Staff
prior to the rezoning, or consideration of the development, by the Wamego
Planning Commission. The recommendations of the Pottawatomie County Sanitarian
shall be considered during review.
      (2)   If the building or buildings are to be served by a public water
and/or sewer system, the minimum lot area is 10,500 square feet for not to
exceed four families. In the case of more than four families in a multiple
dwelling, there shall be at least 1,500 square feet per family.
   (e)   Minimum lot width shall be as required by the Pottawatomie County
Sanitarian if served by a private water and/or sewer system.
   (f)   Where a single lot of record as of the effective date of this Title,
as defined in the definitions section of this Title, has less area than that
specified for multiple-family dwellings, and its boundary lines, along their
entire length, touched land under other ownership on the effective date of this
Title and have not since been changed, such lot may be used only for single-
family dwelling purposes, or for any other non-dwelling use permitted in this
district, provided the structure conforms with other yard and height
requirements of this district and provided safe and effective sanitary controls
can be met as determined by the Pottawatomie County Sanitarian.
§ 17-1205 LOT COVERAGE.
   The principal building and accessory buildings shall not cover more than 40%
of the lot area.
§ 17-1206 HEIGHT REGULATIONS.
   No building shall exceed 45 feet in height.
§ 17-1207 YARD REGULATIONS.
   (a)   Front yard.
      (1)   There shall be a front yard having a depth of not less than 25
feet, except as required for arterial and collector streets in
Article 29 of this Title.
      (2)   Where a lot or lots have a double frontage, the required front yard
shall be provided on both streets.
      (3)   Where a lot is located at the intersection of two or more streets,
there shall be a front yard on each street side of the corner lot; provided,
however, that the buildable width of a single lot of record, as of the
effective date of this Title, shall not be reduced to less than 35 feet.
      (4)   Where a principal or accessory building existing as of the
effective date of this Title, encroaches upon the required 25 foot front yard,
and where the building is on a single lot of record, as defined in the
definitions section of this Title, established prior to the effective date of
said Title and having an area of not more than 7,500 square feet, an addition
to said building shall be permitted, provided the addition does not encroach
further into the required front yard than the furthest projection of said
building, and providing that said addition represents not more than 50% of the
lot coverage of the existing building.
   (b)   Side yard.
      (1)   There shall be a side yard building setback which shall be one-
third the height of the principal building or 10% of the width of the lots
whichever is the greater, with a minimum of five feet, except that, for single-
family attached dwellings, no side yard shall be required along the common
wall. The maximum required setback is 15 feet. A roof overhang of one foot into
the required side yard setback area is permitted.
      (2)   Where more than one principal building is constructed on a tract
for hospitals, nursing homes, churches, schools, institutions of higher
learning, public buildings, or other public or quasi-public uses, the spacing
of said buildings shall not be less than the average height of the adjacent
buildings.
      (3)   Where a principal or accessory building existing as of the
effective date of this Title, encroaches upon the required side yard, and where
the building is on a single lot of record, as defined in the definitions
section of this Title, established prior to the effective date of said Title
and having an area of not more than 7,500 square feet, an addition to said
building shall be permitted, provided the addition does not encroach further
into the required side yard than the furthest projection of said building, and
providing that said addition represents not more than 50% of the lot coverage
of the existing building.
   (c)   Rear yard. There shall be a rear yard for each principal building in
this district which shall have a depth of not less than 25 feet, except that,
where a single-family attached lot is located at the intersection of two or
more streets, no rear yard shall be required along the common wall.
§ 17-1208 SIGN REGULATIONS.
   See
Article 24 of this Title.

   See Article 25of this Title.
